name: Cosmo Police Galivan II: Arrow of Justice
description:
Once again the universe is at peril from invaders from beyond, but this time their target is Earth! Galivan and company don't have time to find items or level up weapons as in Galivan's previous outing; this is a no holds barred slugfest. Three characters are playable, each with varying stats but basically the same moveset. Each character has a standard straight ahead punch or kick, a sweeping kick, an uppercut, and a ranged attack that must be charged up. At the start of the game and the end of every level the player can add stat points to their character to increase their HP, defense, jump height, and strength of normal and special attacks.

A 2 player versus mode is included as well. Both players can choose from the three main characters, and the second player can additionally choose from one of the four normal enemy types.

shot.caption: Title Screen
Selecting a character
And distributing additional stat points
The old neighborhood was so alive.
Blocking.
Dashing into a fight is usually a bad idea.
High attacks have a deceptively wide hitbox, and are your best bet at downing any enemy.
Firing off a charge attack
And finally a short ranged Shoryuken.
Time to start cleaning up these streets.
Enemy type #2, the Borg, are basically the same as Shades, but slightly better in all respects.
Usually you'll run into Borgs just chillin' out.
Ogers, enemy type #3, are stronger, though slower, and will rarely use a short range flame attack.
This may look like a boss, but really she just spits out the same three bosses to fight you before finally dying.
Bad touch! Bad touch!
Level 2-1 introduces the final new enemy type of the game. Greaders are like weaker Ogers that jump and use their ranged attack more often.
Violent J really sold out back in the 90's.
Time to kick this clown back to doing childrens' parties.
Level 3-2 gives Borgs two new abilities. An electrical charge that hits anything near them...
...and a ranged laser blast.
Boss #3 spends altogether too much time leaping onto your head, leading to this scene repeating itself often.
Boss #4 enjoys filling the player with High Fructose Corn Syrup if you let it near you.
I seem to have found the land of Deadelus Passed.
The tiular hero, who isn't any better than his collegues.
To defend himself from attack, Metalhawk cosplays as Pepsiman.
Most of Metalhawk's attacks involve contorting or transforming his body.
